content: Palin replaced as headliner for Republican dinner WASHINGTON (CNN) – Sarah Palin will no longer headline a major Republican dinner in June, a Republican official told CNN Tuesday. Former House speaker Newt Gingrich will replace Palin as the keynote speaker at a joint fundraising dinner held by the campaign committees of Senate and House Republicans. The scheduling change follows a communications breakdown between Palin's political staff and her aides in Alaska that left the dinner's organizers unsure the Alaska governor would actually attend the Washington event. >http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/category/sarah-palin/
reply: Palin replaced as headliner for Republican dinner WASHINGTON (CNN) – Sarah Palin will no longer headline a major Republican dinner in June, a Republican official told CNN Tuesday. The scheduling change follows a communications breakdown between Palin's political staff and her aides in Alaska that left the dinner's organizers unsure the Alaska governor would actually attend the Washington event. >http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/category/sarah-palin/

content: Palin replaced as headliner for Republican dinner WASHINGTON (CNN) – Sarah Palin will no longer headline a major Republican dinner in June, a Republican official told CNN Tuesday. Former House speaker Newt Gingrich will replace Palin as the keynote speaker at a joint fundraising dinner held by the campaign committees of Senate and House Republicans. The scheduling change follows a communications breakdown between Palin's political staff and her aides in Alaska that left the dinner's organizers unsure the Alaska governor would actually attend the Washington event. >http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/category/sarah-palin/

content: Palin replaced as headliner for Republican dinner WASHINGTON (CNN) – Sarah Palin will no longer headline a major Republican dinner in June, a Republican official told CNN Tuesday. Former House speaker Newt Gingrich will replace Palin as the keynote speaker at a joint fundraising dinner held by the campaign committees of Senate and House Republicans. The scheduling change follows a communications breakdown between Palin's political staff and her aides in Alaska that left the dinner's organizers unsure the Alaska governor would actually attend the Washington event. >http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/category/sarah-palin/
